text: This article lists the largest companies in Austria in terms of their revenue, net profit and total assets, according to the American business magazines Fortune and Forbes. == 2019 Fortune list == This list displays all Austrian companies in the Fortune Global 500, which ranks the world's largest companies by annual revenue. The figures below are given in millions of US dollars and are for the fiscal year 2018. Also listed are the headquarters location, net profit, number of employees worldwide and industry sector of each company. {| class="wikitable sortable" !Rank !Fortune 500 rank !Name !Industry !Revenue (USD millions) !Profits (USD millions) !Employees !Headquarters |- |1 |459 |OMV Group |Oil and Gas | style="text-align:center;" |27,061 | style="text-align:center;" |1,789 | style="text-align:center;" |20,231 |Vienna |} == 2019 Forbes list == This list is based on the Forbes Global 2000, which ranks the world's 2,000 largest publicly traded companies. The Forbes list takes into account a multitude of factors, including the revenue, net profit, total assets and market value of each company; each factor is given a weighted rank in terms of importance when considering the overall ranking. The table below also lists the headquarters location and industry sector of each company. The figures are in billions of US dollars and are for the year 2018. All 9 companies from Austria are listed. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:right;" ! align="center" |Rank ! align="center" |Forbes 2000 rank ! align="center" |Name ! align="center" |Headquarters ! align="center" |Revenue (billions US$) ! align="center" |Profit (billions US$) ! align="center" |Assets (billions US$) ! align="center" |Value (billions US$) ! align="center" |Industry |- |1 |391 | align="left" |Erste Group | align="left" |Vienna |11.5 |2.0 |271.5 |17.0 | align="left" |Banking |- |2 |405 | align="left" |OMV Group | align="left" |Vienna |27.1 |1.7 |44.1 |18.2 | align="left" |Oil and Gas |- |3 |636 | align="left" |Raiffeisen Bank International | align="left" |Vienna |8.8 |1.4 |160.2 |8.9 | align="left" |Banking |- |4 |1162 | align="left" |Voestalpine | align="left" |Linz |15.8 |0.6 |17.4 |6.1 | align="left" |Steel |- |5 |1192 | align="left" |Vienna Insurance Group | align="left" |Vienna |11.9 |0.3 |57.2 |3.6 | align="left" |Insurance |- |6 |1362 | align="left" |Strabag | align="left" |Vienna |17.6 |0.5 |13.3 |3.5 | align="left" |Construction |- |7 |1399 | align="left" |Verbund | align="left" |Vienna |3.4 |0.5 |13.4 |17.2 | align="left" |Utilities |- |8 |1424 | align="left" |BAWAG P.S.K. | align="left" |Vienna |1.9 |0.5 |51.1 |5.0 | align="left" |Banking |- |9 |1607 | align="left" |Uniqa Insurance Group | align="left" |Vienna |6.7 |0.3 |32.4 |3.3 | align="left" |Insurance |} == See also == * Economy of Austria * List of companies of Austria * List of largest companies by revenue == References == Austria * * companies Category:Economy-related lists of superlatives
title: List of largest Austrian companies
